column2: A sacred carved pillar bearing deep religious significance for the local pagan tribes.

column2: College of Cardinals & Antipope mechanics are unchanged.
Reformed Pagan religions with a hierocratic head will have College of Cardinals mechanics, as will Zoroastrians, Jews, & Manichaeans.
Reformed Pagan religions with a hierocratic head will have Antipopes, as will Zoroastrians, Jews, & Manichaeans.
Reformed Pagan religions with a hierocratic head will have Antipopes & College of Cardinals mechanics, as will Zoroastrians, Jews, & Manichaeans.
Only theocratic characters may be appointed Cardinals.
Theocracies & Heads of Holy Orders may both be appointed as Cardinals.
Reformed Pagan religions without a head will only have access to the four default pagan branch traits
Reformed Pagan religions without a head will have access to the pagan branch traits from More Pagan Branches
This Grand Experiment is a piece of the Ancient World brought to life, giving the finest minds in [Owner.PrimaryTitle.GetName] a classical education.
This Grand Experiment is a piece of the Ancient World brought to life, giving the finest minds in [Owner.PrimaryTitle.GetName] a classical education.

[From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick] believes that [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] is wicked, corrupt, & unsuited to lead the [Root.Religion.GetName] faithful- [Root.GetTitledFirstName] would obviously be a better choice!
There has not been an §GAnti[From.RelHead.GetTitle]§! for at least §G50 years§!
Choose someone to succeed [Root.GetTitledFirstName] as [Root.GetTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
The individual that was appointed to succeed [From.GetTitledFirstName] as [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] no longer qualifies for the position.
I no longer believe that the person I appointed to succeed [Root.GetTitledFirstName] is up to the job.
[Root.GetBestName] was appointed to succeed [From.GetTitledFirstName] as [From.GetTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
Ask [Root.GetTitledFirstName] to appoint someone of my choosing as the next [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
The individual that I nominated as the next [Root.Religion.GetPriestTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] no longer qualifies for the position.
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! has §RNOT§! refused the nomination of §Y[This.GetBestName]§! in the last §Y10§! years.
You will send a letter to [Root.GetTitledFirstName], asking [Root.GetHerHim] to approve the nomination of [FromFrom.GetBestName]
I no longer support [pagan_papal_priest_nominee.GetBestName] as the next [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName].

I, [From.GetTitledFirstNameWithNick], have graciously decided to accede to your petition. [pagan_papal_priest_nominee.GetBestName] shall be the the next [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], by the Grace of [From.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap].
Alas, [pagan_papal_priest_nominee.GetBestName] is no longer with us...

While I am certain you had your reasons for nominating [pagan_papal_priest_nominee.GetFirstName] as [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], I must admit I find [pagan_papal_priest_nominee.GetHerHim] lacking in certain [From.Religion.GetPriestTitle]ly qualities. Your request has been denied.
Blood of the Old & New Kingdoms
The age of the Cross & the Moon has ended. For three millennia Kemet stood tall, the envy of all the world- & [From.Founder.Religion.GetHighGodNameCap] willing, it will do so again.

Most of the language & customs of Ancient Egypt have been lost to the mists of time, forever beyond our reach- but if I were to carefully piece together what little information we have, I might be able to contruct a modern facsimile of the ancient ways...
As I become more exposed to the reconstructed Ancient Egyptian ways, they start to seem not so strange after all. Perhaps the keys to the future lie in the past?

Most of the language & customs of Pre-Roman Gaul have been lost to the mists of time, forever beyond our reach- but if I were to carefully piece together what little information we have, I might be able to contruct a modern facsimile of the ancient ways...
As I become more exposed to the reconstructed Gaulish ways, they start to seem not so strange after all. Perhaps the keys to the future lie in the past?
Revival of the Ancient Egyptian Culture!

By delicately combing through what little records [From.GetSheHe] had, [From.GetTitledNameWithNick] has announced that the [From.Culture.GetName] ways of the Ancient World shall live once more. Already they have adopted the [From.Culture.GetName] in their court. Only time will tell if [From.Culture.GetName] culture will take hold among the people of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName] or remain the curious experiment of a few power-drunk [From.GetLordLady]s.
Perhaps I should follow in [From.GetHerHis] footsteps...
A glorious day for the people of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]!
I have acquired one of the fragments of the Shield of Achilles, legendary Hero of the Trojan War. If I can acquire the other fragments, I might be able to have my smiths reforge it...
I possess at least §Y4 fragments§! of the Shield of Achilles
I have access to a §YLegendary Armory§!, worthy of the Gods
There is at least 1 §G[Root.Religion.GetName] Ancestor Worship§! bloodline in existence
[acr_target_ancestor.GetBestName] is one of the [GetSaintViewTitle] of the [acr_target_ancestor.Religion.GetName] faith
